14#ifndef _DNSTAP_H
15#define _DNSTAP_H
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file
22 * \brief
23 * The dt (dnstap) module provides fast passive logging of DNS messages.
24 * Protocol Buffers. The protobuf schema for Dnstap messages is in the
25 * file dnstap.proto, which is compiled to dnstap.pb-c.c and dnstap.pb-c.h.
26 */
27
28#include <inttypes.h>
29#include <stdbool.h>
30
31#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
32#include <fstrm.h>
33#include <protobuf-c/protobuf-c.h>
34#else
35struct fstrm_iothr_options;
36#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
37
38#include <isc/log.h>
39#include <isc/refcount.h>
40#include <isc/region.h>
41#include <isc/sockaddr.h>
42#include <isc/time.h>
43#include <isc/types.h>
44
45#include <dns/name.h>
46#include <dns/rdataclass.h>
47#include <dns/rdatatype.h>
48#include <dns/types.h>
49
50/*%
51 * Dnstap message types:
52 *
53 * STUB QUERY: SQ
54 * STUB RESPONSE: SR
55 * CLIENT QUERY: CQ
56 * CLIENT RESPONSE: CR
57 * AUTH QUERY: AQ
58 * AUTH RESPONSE: AR
59 * RESOLVER QUERY: RQ
60 * RESOLVER RESPONSE: RR
61 * FORWARDER QUERY: FQ
62 * FORWARDER RESPONSE: FR
63 */
64
65#define DNS_DTTYPE_SQ 0x0001
66#define DNS_DTTYPE_SR 0x0002
67#define DNS_DTTYPE_CQ 0x0004
68#define DNS_DTTYPE_CR 0x0008
69#define DNS_DTTYPE_AQ 0x0010
70#define DNS_DTTYPE_AR 0x0020
71#define DNS_DTTYPE_RQ 0x0040
72#define DNS_DTTYPE_RR 0x0080
73#define DNS_DTTYPE_FQ 0x0100
74#define DNS_DTTYPE_FR 0x0200
75#define DNS_DTTYPE_TQ 0x0400
76#define DNS_DTTYPE_TR 0x0800
77#define DNS_DTTYPE_UQ 0x1000
78#define DNS_DTTYPE_UR 0x2000
79
80#define DNS_DTTYPE_QUERY \
81 (DNS_DTTYPE_SQ|DNS_DTTYPE_CQ|DNS_DTTYPE_AQ|\
82 DNS_DTTYPE_RQ|DNS_DTTYPE_FQ|DNS_DTTYPE_TQ|\
83 DNS_DTTYPE_UQ)
84#define DNS_DTTYPE_RESPONSE \
85 (DNS_DTTYPE_SR|DNS_DTTYPE_CR|DNS_DTTYPE_AR|\
86 DNS_DTTYPE_RR|DNS_DTTYPE_FR|DNS_DTTYPE_TR|\
87 DNS_DTTYPE_UR)
88#define DNS_DTTYPE_ALL \
89 (DNS_DTTYPE_QUERY|DNS_DTTYPE_RESPONSE)
90
91typedef enum {
92 dns_dtmode_none = 0,
93 dns_dtmode_file,
94 dns_dtmode_unix
95} dns_dtmode_t;
96
97typedef struct dns_dthandle dns_dthandle_t;
98
99#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
100struct dns_dtdata {
101 isc_mem_t *mctx;
102
103 void *frame;
104
105 bool query;
106 bool tcp;
107 dns_dtmsgtype_t type;
108
109 isc_time_t qtime;
110 isc_time_t rtime;
111
112 isc_region_t qaddr;
113 isc_region_t raddr;
114
115 uint32_t qport;
116 uint32_t rport;
117
118 isc_region_t msgdata;
119 dns_message_t *msg;
120
121 char namebuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
122 char typebuf[DNS_RDATATYPE_FORMATSIZE];
123 char classbuf[DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE];
124};
125#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
126
127isc_result_t
128dns_dt_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_dtmode_t mode, const char *path,
129 struct fstrm_iothr_options **foptp, isc_task_t *reopen_task,
130 dns_dtenv_t **envp);
131/*%<
132 * Create and initialize the dnstap environment.
133 *
134 * There should be a single global dnstap environment for the server;
135 * copies of it will be attached to each view.
136 *
137 * Notes:
138 *
139 *\li 'path' refers to a UNIX domain socket by default. It may
140 * optionally be prepended with "socket:" or "file:". If prepended
141 * with "file:", then dnstap logs are sent to a file instead of a
142 * socket.
143 *
144 *\li '*foptp' set the options for fstrm_iothr_init(). '*foptp' must have
145 * have had the number of input queues set and this should be set
146 * to the number of worker threads. Additionally the queue model
147 * should also be set. Other options may be set if desired.
148 * If dns_dt_create succeeds the *foptp is set to NULL.
149 *
150 *\li 'reopen_task' needs to be set to the task in the context of which
151 * dns_dt_reopen() will be called. This is not an optional parameter:
152 * using dns_dt_create() (which sets 'reopen_task' to NULL) is only
153 * allowed in unit tests.
154 *
155 * Requires:
156 *
157 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
158 *
159 *\li 'path' is a valid C string.
160 *
161 *\li 'foptp' is non NULL.
162 *
163 *\li envp != NULL && *envp == NULL
164 *
165 * Returns:
166 *
167 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
168 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
169 *
170 *\li Other errors are possible.
171 */
172
173isc_result_t
174dns_dt_setupfile(dns_dtenv_t *env, uint64_t max_size, int rolls,
175 isc_log_rollsuffix_t suffix);
176/*%<
177 * Sets up the dnstap logfile limits.
178 *
179 * 'max_size' is the size a log file may grow before it is rolled
180 *
181 * 'rolls' is the number of rolled files to retain.
182 *
183 * 'suffix' is the logfile suffix setting, increment or timestamp.
184 *
185 * Requires:
186 *
187 *\li 'env' is a valid dnstap environment.
188 *
189 * Returns:
190 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS on success
191 *\li #ISC_R_INVALIDFILE if dnstap is set to use a UNIX domain socket
192 */
193
194isc_result_t
195dns_dt_reopen(dns_dtenv_t *env, int roll);
196/*%<
197 * Reopens files established by dns_dt_create2().
198 *
199 * If 'roll' is non-negative and 'env->mode' is dns_dtmode_file,
200 * then the file is automatically rolled over before reopening.
201 * The value of 'roll' indicates the number of backup log files to
202 * keep. If 'roll' is negative, or if 'env->mode' is dns_dtmode_unix,
203 * then the channel is simply reopened.
204 *
205 * Note: dns_dt_reopen() uses task-exclusive mode and must be run in the
206 * context of env->reopen_task.
207 *
208 * Requires:
209 *\li 'env' is a valid dnstap environment.
210 */
211
212isc_result_t
213dns_dt_setidentity(dns_dtenv_t *env, const char *identity);
214isc_result_t
215dns_dt_setversion(dns_dtenv_t *env, const char *version);
216/*%<
217 * Set the "identity" and "version" strings to be sent in dnstap messages.
218 *
219 * Requires:
220 *
221 *\li 'env' is a valid dnstap environment.
222 */
223
224void
225dns_dt_attach(dns_dtenv_t *source, dns_dtenv_t **destp);
226/*%<
227 * Attach '*destp' to 'source', incrementing the reference counter.
228 *
229 * Requires:
230 *
231 *\li 'source' is a valid dnstap environment.
232 *
233 *\li 'destp' is not NULL and '*destp' is NULL.
234 *
235 *\li *destp is attached to source.
236 */
237
238void
239dns_dt_detach(dns_dtenv_t **envp);
240/*%<
241 * Detach '*envp', decrementing the reference counter.
242 *
243 * Requires:
244 *
245 *\li '*envp' is a valid dnstap environment.
246 *
247 * Ensures:
248 *
249 *\li '*envp' will be destroyed when the number of references reaches zero.
250 *
251 *\li '*envp' is NULL.
252 */
253
254isc_result_t
255dns_dt_getstats(dns_dtenv_t *env, isc_stats_t **statsp);
256/*%<
257 * Attach to the stats struct if it exists.
258 *
259 * Requires:
260 *
261 *\li 'env' is a valid dnstap environment.
262 *
263 *\li 'statsp' is non NULL and '*statsp' is NULL.
264 *
265 * Returns:
266 *
267 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
268 *
269 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
270 */
271
272void
273dns_dt_shutdown(void);
274/*%<
275 * Shuts down dnstap and frees global resources. This function must only
276 * be called immediately before server shutdown.
277 */
278
279void
280dns_dt_send(dns_view_t *view, dns_dtmsgtype_t msgtype,
281 isc_sockaddr_t *qaddr, isc_sockaddr_t *dstaddr,
282 bool tcp, isc_region_t *zone, isc_time_t *qtime,
283 isc_time_t *rtime, isc_buffer_t *buf);
284/*%<
285 * Sends a dnstap message to the log, if 'msgtype' is one of the message
286 * types represented in 'view->dttypes'.
287 *
288 * Parameters are: 'qaddr' (query address, i.e, the address of the
289 * query initiator); 'raddr' (response address, i.e., the address of
290 * the query responder); 'tcp' (boolean indicating whether the transaction
291 * was over TCP); 'zone' (the authoritative zone or bailiwick, in
292 * uncompressed wire format), 'qtime' and 'rtime' (query and response
293 * times; if NULL, they are set to the current time); and 'buf' (the
294 * DNS message being logged, in wire format).
295 *
296 * Requires:
297 *
298 *\li 'view' is a valid view, and 'view->dtenv' is NULL or is a
299 * valid dnstap environment.
300 */
301
302isc_result_t
303dns_dt_parse(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_region_t *src, dns_dtdata_t **destp);
304/*%<
305 * Converts a raw dnstap frame in 'src' to a parsed dnstap data structure
306 * in '*destp'.
307 *
308 * Requires:
309 *\li 'src' is not NULL
310 *
311 *\li 'destp' is not NULL and '*destp' points to a valid buffer.
312 *
313 * Returns:
314 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS on success
315 *
316 *\li Other errors are possible.
317 */
318
319isc_result_t
320dns_dt_datatotext(dns_dtdata_t *d, isc_buffer_t **dest);
321/*%<
322 * Converts a parsed dnstap data structure 'd' to text, storing
323 * the result in the buffer 'dest'. If 'dest' points to a dynamically
324 * allocated buffer, then it may be reallocated as needed.
325 *
326 * (XXX: add a 'long_form' option to generate a detailed listing of
327 * dnstap data instead * of a one-line summary.)
328 *
329 * Requires:
330 *\li 'd' is not NULL
331 *
332 *\li 'dest' is not NULL and '*dest' points to a valid buffer.
333 *
334 * Returns:
335 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS on success
336 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE if buffer is not dynamic and runs out of space
337 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY if buffer is dynamic but memory could not be allocated
338 *
339 *\li Other errors are possible.
340 */
341
342void
343dns_dtdata_free(dns_dtdata_t **dp);
344/*%<
345 * Frees the specified dns_dtdata structure and all its members,
346 * and sets *dp to NULL.
347 */
348
349isc_result_t
350dns_dt_open(const char *filename, dns_dtmode_t mode,
351 isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_dthandle_t **handlep);
352/*%<
353 * Opens a dnstap framestream at 'filename' and stores a pointer to the
354 * reader object in a dns_dthandle_t structure.
355 *
356 * The caller is responsible for allocating the handle structure.
357 *
358 * (XXX: Currently only file readers are supported, not unix-domain socket
359 * readers.)
360 *
361 * Requires:
362 *
363 *\li 'filename' is not NULL.
364 *
365 *\li 'handlep' is not NULL and '*handlep' is NULL.
366 *
367 *\li '*mctx' is not a valid memory context.
368 *
369 * Returns:
370 *
371 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS on success
372 *\li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED if 'mode' is not dns_dtmode_file. (XXX)
373 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY if the fstrm library was unable to allocate a
374 * reader or options structure
375 *\li #ISC_R_FAILURE if 'filename' could not be opened.
376 *\li #DNS_R_BADDNSTAP if 'filename' does not contain a dnstap
377 * framestream.
378 */
379
380isc_result_t
381dns_dt_getframe(dns_dthandle_t *handle, uint8_t **bufp, size_t *sizep);
382/*%<
383 * Read a dnstap frame from the framstream reader in 'handle', storing
384 * a pointer to it in '*bufp' and its size in '*sizep'.
385 *
386 * Requires:
387 *
388 *\li 'handle' is not NULL
389 *\li 'bufp' is not NULL
390 *\li 'sizep' is not NULL
391 *
392 * Ensures:
393 * \li if returning ISC_R_SUCCESS then '*bufp' is not NULL
394 *
395 * Returns:
396 *
397 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS on success
398 *\li #ISC_R_NOMORE at the end of the frame stream
399 *\li #ISC_R_FAILURE for any other failure
400 */
401
402void
403dns_dt_close(dns_dthandle_t **handlep);
404/*%<
405 * Closes the dnstap file referenced by 'handle'.
406 *
407 * Requires:
408 *
409 *\li '*handlep' is not NULL
410 */
411
412#endif /* _DNSTAP_H */
413
